Zachariah or Zacharias__11.1: Open thy gates, <u>O Libanus</u>, and let fire devour <u>thy cedars</u>.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.2: Howl, thou fir tree, for the cedar is fallen, for the mighty are laid waste: howl, ye oaks of Basan, because the fenced forest is cut down.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.3: The voice of the howling of the shepherds, because their glory is laid waste: the voice of the roaring of the lions, because the pride of the Jordan is spoiled.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.4: Thus saith the Lord my God: Feed the flock of the slaughter,
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.5: Which they that possessed, slew, and repented not, and they sold them, saying: Blessed be the Lord, we are become rich: and their shepherds spared them not.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.6: And I will no more spare the inhabitants of the land, saith the Lord: behold I will deliver the men, <u>every one into his neighbour's hand</u>, and into the hand of his king: and they shall destroy the land, and I will not deliver it out of their hand.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.7: And I will feed the flock of slaughter for this, O ye poor of the flock. And I took unto me <u>two rods</u>, one I called Beauty, and the other I called a Cord, and I fed the flock.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.8: And I cut off <u>three shepherds in one month</u>, and my soul was straitened in their regard: for their soul also varied in my regard.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.9: And I said: I will not feed you: that which dieth, let it die: and that which is cut off, let it be cut off: and let the rest devour every one the flesh of his neighbour.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.10: And I took my rod that was called Beauty, and I cut it asunder to make void my covenant, which I had made with all people.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.11: And it was made void in that day: and so the poor of the flock that keep for me, understood that it is the word of the Lord.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.12: And I said to them: If it be good in your eyes, bring hither my wages: and if not, be quiet. And they weighed for my wages thirty pieces of silver.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.13: And the Lord said to me: Cast it to <u>the statuary</u>, a handsome price, that I was prized at by them. And I took the thirty pieces of silver, and I cast them into the house of the Lord to the statuary.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.14: And I cut off my second rod that was called a Cord, that I might break the brotherhood between Juda and Israel.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.15: And the Lord said to me: Take to thee yet the instruments of <u>a foolish shepherd</u>.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.16: For behold I will raise up a shepherd in the land, who shall not visit what is forsaken, nor seek what is scattered, nor heal what is broken, nor nourish that which standeth, and he shall eat the flesh of the fat ones, and break their hoofs.
Zachariah or Zacharias__11.17: O shepherd, and idol, that forsaketh the flock: the sword upon his arm and upon his right eye: his arm shall quite wither away, and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.
